<JD_START>
Job Title: Vice President, Practice Administrative

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance, Human Resources

Description:
Summary:The Vice President of Practice Management is responsible for oversight of the practice Management function for physician practice clients, including team of practice managers that support strategic, administrative and HR functions for clients and team of practice support personnel that support financial statement preparation, payroll, and expense reimbursements. Leader must ensure high level of management service to clients, have strong technical knowledge of practice management, and develop strong relationships with physician practices that they support to ensure we are delighting our clients and delivering high quality of services to support their groups.
Essential Functions and Duties:Responsible for best-in-class practice management services for our physician practice clients, including servicing as a trusted advisor and providing strategic guidance and doing day to day business of running their group, including HR, payroll, financials, and other on-going management functions. Must have executive presence, and the ability to liaison with clients, assess business needs, and deliver strategic business guidanceOversee continued process improvements to performance, including documentation of processes, tracking and monitoring of monthly and annual contract requirements, standardization and automation, establishment of appropriate financial controls, and pro-actively communicating with client partners.Manage, develop/train, and lead the Practice Management team; inspiring, motivating, training, and mentoring: Identify resource needs and right-sizing the team to ensure high talent and right blend of resources, including use of global support colleagues.Develop right go-to-market strategy for team, developing staffing model for different new client business needs. Ensure timely, accurate reporting to clients, with pro-active insights on performance.Ensure appropriate vendor management (financial and payroll systems).Ensure compliance with various reporting requirements, including payroll taxes, retirement plans, insurance reporting, etc. on behalf of clients, serving as their key fiduciary.Lead monthly and quarterly business reviews, reporting key financial performance.Establish, maintain, and update Practice Management policies, objectives, and initiatives focused on accountability and management well-being of clients.Ensure all client concerns and issues are resolved in a timely, compliant manner with appropriate feedback loops to client stakeholders. Ensure direct, concise, and timely communication for all aspects of effective client services. Performs special projects and other duties as assigned. 
Education and Experience Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in business/accounting, with CPA preferred, or experience overseeing a bookkeeping/accounting team.At least seven (7) years in practice management leadership roles with progressively increased responsibility.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Strong familiarity with medical practice management and issues unique to medical groupsStrategic thinking and ability to solveKnowledge of cash and accrual accountingExperience with Quickbooks, Paychex, or similar vendor toolsAbility to review and oversee preparation of financial statements and pro-forma informationFamiliarity with revenue cycle performance, including healthcare reimbursementFamiliarity with payroll tax reporting requirements at federal and state levelsAbility to communicate with diverse personalities in a tactful, mature, and professional mannerAbility to remain flexible and work within a collaborative and fast paced environmentAbility to deliver high quality service excellence with high attention to detailUnderstand and comply with company policies and proceduresProven strong leadership/management skills to manage, motivate, and set expectations with team membersStrong customer service and customer facing skillsStrong judgment skills and problem-solving skills Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skillsStrong time management, organizational, and decision-making skills

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
